page.title: 03The Waltham Village Tannery.
page.content: There has been a Tannery in Waltham on the same site for three to four hundred years in Skinners Lane. The present building is one hundred years old. At the bottom of the Lane were some old lime pits which at some time provided lime for use in the tanning process. The Tannery employs twelve people.It produces leather suitable for industrial clothing mainly for the heavy engineering and mining industries in this country.It also exports leather to Scandinavian countries,Canada and Mauritius. It buys hide in the "wet blue" stage and reprocesses it at the tannery to produce leather.The hide bought is a by product from the shoe and upholstery industries. The Waltham Tannery is one of two tanneries in this country.
